content:

This seems to happen more frequently recently, but not every time, as far as I know. But this is a relatively new problem, possibly related to a new laptop. Occasionally I get a message that there is trouble restoring my session.

title: March 31, 2025 computer crash created by faulty Firefox 137.0 update conflicting with Spectrum Security Suite (F-Secure Total)
content: The title says it all. How do I know my crashed Dell Latitude 5500 (NOT E5500) , 512GB M2 NVME, 32GB DDR4 2400 RAM, W11 Pro x64 is now truly healed and with no glitches due to Firefox 137.0 x64 conflicting with Spectrum Security Suite (most current version by F-Secure {TOTAL} as of 03-31-2025) and thereby crashing the entire computer. I have recovered 90whatever percent functionality to the computer, but cannot take the chance of re-installing Security Suite if there is an unresolved conflict not yet addressed and corrected. I've seen the Mozilla Connection entry about another crash similar to mine involving a different Antimalware APP. And I have seen the posting about the fix applied to correct the same type issues with a Chinese provided Antimalware APP. Has ANYONE addressed Firefox 137.0 induced conflicts with other security APPS like my Spectrum Security Suite? I cannot re-install Security Suite until or IF the conflicts that crashed my Dell 5500 have been addressed and corrected. I'd had to use a 2nd backup computer to go online, find, download, copy to a USB thumbdrive, a "suite" of online security scanners AND proprietary uninstallers, copy all of those to the crashed computer, install the necessary ones, run the scanners to check for malware infection(s), none were found, THEN run the F-Secure uninstaller, successfully removing Security Suite. THEN I had to run Firefox in Safe Mode to find and correct all the damaged website URLs the crash involved. Some 30(?) websites I could not get to until i repaired them. NOW, how do I get Firefox 137.x checked for conflicts with Spectrum Security Suite and have them corrected so I can have my Firefox AND Antimalware APP running together? Please let me know and Thank you for being here for us, JEC OldHeart1943

title: Why can't I install Firefox on a Windows tablet?
content:
Hello, everyone,

I don't seem able to install Firefox on a Windows tablet (at least I think it's a tablet, it's an Asus Transformer Book, with a tablet screen and a detachable keyboard, anyway). Does anyone have any ideas why, please?

I should warn anyone before they read on that I am in no way techie, so helping me may be frustrating at times as I need advice/instructions etc spelled out really simply, as anything too technical is beyond me, I'm afraid.

So, anyone brave and/or patient enough to read on... I've bought the tablet secondhand, 'wiped' etc. It's an Asus T100HAN Processor: Intel(R) Atom(TM) x5-Z8500 CPU@ 1.44GHz 1.44GHz Installed memory: 2.00GB System type: 64-bit Operating System, 64-based processor Pen and touch: Full Windows Touch Support with 10 Touch Points

It's currently running Windows 10 Home, but I'm hoping to install Linux Mint on it, although it's only since I bought it that it's occurred to me that putting Linux on it might not be as straightforward as I thought, (ie I'm typing this on a laptop that came with Windows but on which I installed Linux Mint. "If Linux runs on this, it must run on anything that can handle Windows," I thought to myself before buying the tablet. But now I've realised that, eg, this laptop doesn't have a touchscreen, not does the screen have to rotate, which is the main reason for buying the tablet.)

That's sort of a digression, but might not be, as it explains why my priority right now is installing Firefox on the machine - so that even if it turns out I can't install Linux on it, at least I'll have Firefox rather than Edge or whatever.

So, in the Edge that came already on the machine, I accessed the official Mozilla page (despite getting several scary warnings from Edge about there being a problem with "this website's" security certificate, oh, and something about "Windows SmartScreen can't be reached at the moment") and downloaded Firefox. I went for the desktop version because that seemed more relevant than the Android or iOS versions. Then I've told it to "Run". The installer thing has come up and the little colour wave thing has happened with the icon in the taskbar (or whatever it's called). And then, after several minutes, I've got a message from Firefox Installer: "Hmm. For some reason, we could not install Firefox. Choose OK to start again." So I've clicked on OK, and the same thing has happened. Several times. And I've downloaded Firefox umpteen times as well, just in case there'd been an issue with that first download, only the same thing has happened, over and over again.

From the "about" thing, it looks like the 30GB or so of storage on the tablet, but about 10GB(!!!) is taken up by "system files to help Windows run properly. Your PC won't work without them."

Can anyone explain, please, what's going on, and what (if anything) I can do to get the wretched thing to allow me to install Firefox? I could just about cope if I can't get Linux, but no Firefox??? No, no no!

Thanks, Alice.
creator: FirefoxFan

title: Ajuda para recuperar janela fechada com várias abas
content:
Bom dia, equipe do Firefox!

Gostaria de pedir ajuda com uma situação que estou enfrentando.

Há cerca de 3 meses, fechei acidentalmente uma janela do Firefox que continha várias abas importantes. Na época, não consegui recuperá-la, e desde então já reiniciei o computador diversas vezes e abri várias outras janelas e abas. Ontem, por acaso, acredito que cliquei duas vezes no ícone do Firefox da barra de tarefas e, para minha surpresa, essa janela antiga apareceu novamente. Fiquei muito feliz, pois eram abas que eu precisava muito. No entanto, logo em seguida, acabei fechando a janela achando que poderia restaurá-la facilmente pelo menu "Histórico > Reabrir janela fechada", mas não consegui mais recuperá-la, ela simplesmente não aparece.

Sabe me informar o que aconteceu? Existe alguma forma de restaurar essa janela com as abas que estavam abertas? Agradeço muito se puderem me orientar.

Atenciosamente, Célio Neves de Araújo celiopirapama@yahoo.com.br

title: When I try and access a web server on a port, how do I stop Firefox redirecting?
content:
Let's imagine that I'm trying to access a server on port 80, let's call it http://example.com:80 . I'd like to see if that site is actually active. When I try and do that Firefox instead goes to https://example.com:443 . In my example, that's actually a completely different site that I do not want to access (for completeness port 80 is used for certificate renewal of a whole bunch of different names that are all set up on other ports, of which 443 is one).

In both a regular Firefox browsing window and in a private browsing window, Firefox decides to access https://example.com:443 instead of http://example.com:80 , despite me explicitly typing "http://example.com:80" in the URL bar.

How do I prevent Firefox from doing this when I explicitly request an http site?

title: 2 of 6 windows not visible
content:
I'm on a 2017 Macbook Pro. I believe I was using Firefox 137.0 but have now gone back to the last saved update session file which is 133.0.3.

When I close Firefox, it clearly recognises all the open windows as it asks if I want to close all 6 windows. When I reopen Firefox it briefly shows all the windows in position but before it reopens all the tabs in those windows, 2 of them disappear. If I open a new tab and start typing something I know is in those missing windows it suggests "Switch to tab". If I click on that the current window dulls as if the requested window and its tabs have become active but the entire window is invisible. I have tried renaming xulstore and localstore and tried deleting xulstore entirely. Neither worked. It's possible that I hit some mental combination of shift, command and something near the 3 or 4 keys on the keyboard as I was trying to take a quick screenshot on a website before a pop up reappeared. This was the last session where everything was as it should be. I wish I hadn't gone back to the saved update session from December as its clear the app still recognises the windows are "there". I've reopened it so many times since having deleted tabs, cookies, whatnot that the session I was in before things went pear shaped is now long gone. If I click on the icon for recent browsing it shows 6 windows and I subsequently deleted some tabs from the missing windows that might've been an issue, were recent, or might use more power like Youtube or news sites. On restarting, the 2 missing windows remain invisible. In the words of Penelope Pitstop. "Hayulp!" Any guidance or tissues gratefully received.

content: Hi, so basically for the past few days my YouTube Premium has randomly stopped showing me my YouTube Music and it refuses to work. The page still loads, it just doesn't play any songs. When I check on Chrome and on mobile it's perfectly fine, so I have no idea what the issue is. I've tried to see if other people have had this issue as well but they either never got answers or I tried a solution and it didn't work for me. I have the latest version of Firefox as well. title: Firefox accounts And Mozilla accounts
content: I registered an account with Firefox in 2022. It was a Firefox account and I can still log in at https://accounts.firefox.com.cn/. This account contains my browsing history and bookmarked websites. Now in April 2025, I have a new computer and have installed the latest version of Firefox. When I tried to log in, I found that I couldn't use the Firefox account anymore. I have to use a Mozilla account. As a result, I can't synchronize my past browsing information. Can the data of the two accounts be merged? Or is there any other way to export the browsing data and bookmark information from the Firefox account? 我在2022年使用Firefox浏览器时注册了一个账户，这是一个firefox账户，我现在还可以在https://accounts.firefox.com.cn/登录，这个账户里有我的浏览信息和书签网站，现在2025年4月，我有了一台新的电脑并安装了最新版本的Firefox浏览器，当我想登录的时候发现不能使用Firefox账户，必须要使用Mozilla账户，这样我无法同步过去的浏览信息，两个账户能否合并数据？或者其他方法导出Firefox账户里的浏览数据和书签信息？

title: Firefox stopped loading
content:
Good evening (or morning, depending on your time of day)

As of about 3 days ago, in the middle of browsing, Firefox stopped loading any and all pages I tried to go to. There are occasional times where, if Firefox initially opens from a link, it will start to load the page, but then stop partway and, although it claims to be loading, will make zero progress and eventually time out. Since then, I have done a Firefox refresh, full uninstall and reinstall of the program, defragmented and done a virus scan of my computer to no results and still have had no luck fixing the issue. I've tried opening the troubleshoot mode, but any attempts to do so have been met in error, as Firefox closes to reopen, but never reopens and instead gives a crash report that it states can't be sent. In fact, that crash report that can't be sent shows up for every time Firefox closes, making the app not even open until I clear that report. I've attached pictures of the browser console that I've not had any luck assessing, the problem loading page that is not showing the same timeout error it had previously, and the crash report that it states cannot be sent.

If anyone has any solutions, that would be wonderful and I'd be extremely grateful. Thank you very much in advance.
creator: Dementisxyz
